title: Types of ADHD
author: Stephanie Watson

content: When it comes to ADHD , no one diagnosis or treatment fits all. Everyone is different. The American Psychiatric Association has identified three types. Each has different symptoms, and treatments are based on those symptoms.

content_blocks.text: When it comes to ADHD , no one diagnosis or treatment fits all. Everyone is different. The American Psychiatric Association has identified three types. Each has different symptoms, and treatments are based on those symptoms.

sections.heading: Inattentive Type
content: A person with this type must have at least six of these nine symptoms, and very few of the symptoms of hyperactive - impulsive type:
bullets: Failing to pay attention and keep on task
Being unable to follow or understand instructions
Losing things that are needed to complete tasks

content_blocks.text: A person with this type must have at least six of these nine symptoms, and very few of the symptoms of hyperactive - impulsive type:
associated_bullets: Failing to pay attention and keep on task
Being unable to follow or understand instructions
Losing things that are needed to complete tasks

sections.heading: Hyperactive-Impulsive Type
content: To have this type, a person has to have at least six of these nine symptoms, and very few of the symptoms of inattentive type:
bullets: Running or climbing at inappropriate times
Talking out of turn or blurting out
Often “on the go” as if “driven by a motor”

content_blocks.text: To have this type, a person has to have at least six of these nine symptoms, and very few of the symptoms of inattentive type:
associated_bullets: Running or climbing at inappropriate times
Talking out of turn or blurting out
Often “on the go” as if “driven by a motor”

sections.heading: Combined Type
content: This is the most common type of ADHD. People with it have symptoms of both inattentive and hyperactive-impulsive types.

content_blocks.text: This is the most common type of ADHD. People with it have symptoms of both inattentive and hyperactive-impulsive types.

The American Psychiatric Association. Council on Children, Adolescents and Their Families: "Brain Imaging and Child and Adolescent Psychiatry with Special Emphasis on Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)."

meta_description: WebMD explains the different types of ADHD.
